page.title: 17THE AMBULANCE SCHOOL
page.content: The Ambulance training school in Claylands Road was originally a{Civil {Defence}Training School which was opened for Ambulance Personnel in 1968. Seventy or eighty men and women come from all over the South of England for different courses lasting up to six weeks. The{Local Health Authority runs the school and equipment includes two ambulances, one Range Rover and a minibus. The facilities at the school are shared with both the{Police}and the {Fire Brigade}and at the moment new premises are being built at Chippenham (about 75 miles away). Then this important ambulance station{will move {away}from Bishops Waltham - probably in 1986.
